quask.resources package

Submodules

quask.techniques.combinatorial_kernel module

Code base for https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.11144. This module allow to convert a parametric quantum circuit into a matrix representation. Furthermore, it allows to generate a parameteric kernel function parameterized by such circuit matrix representation.

quask.techniques.combinatorial_kernel.CombinatorialFeatureMap(x, n_qubits, n_layers, solution, bandwidth)[source]

Generate a PennyLane feature map starting from the matrix representation of the circuit

Parameters:

  • x – feature data

  • n_qubits – number of qubits of the circuit

  • n_layers – number of layers of the circuit

  • solution – matrix representation of the circuit

  • bandwidth – optional constant limiting the rotational angles of the transformations

Returns:

numpy matrix

quask.techniques.combinatorial_kernel.CombinatorialKernel(n_qubits, n_layers)[source]

Generate a kernel function starting from a given CombinatorialFeatureMap object.

Parameters:

  • n_qubits – number of qubits of the circuit

  • n_layers – number of layers of the circuit

Returns:

kernel function having the parameters x1, x2, the_solution, the_bandwidth and returning a scalar value

quask.techniques.combinatorial_kernel.create_identity_combinatorial_kernel(n_qubits, n_layers)[source]

Create a matrix representation for the identity circuit according to the scheme in https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.11144

Parameters:

  • n_qubits – number of qubits of the circuit

  • n_layers – number of layers of the circuit

Returns:

numpy matrix

quask.techniques.combinatorial_kernel.create_operation(n_qubits, n_layers, index, pauli, angle)[source]

Append to the Pennylane circuit a quantum transformation having the specified configuration according to the scheme in https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.11144

Parameters:

  • n_qubits – number of qubits of the circuit

  • n_layers – number of layers of the circuit

  • index – number of operation within the circuit (determine if it is a single or two-qubits operation and its position)

  • pauli – determines the generators

  • angle – feature corresponding to the angle of the transformation

Returns:

None

quask.techniques.combinatorial_kernel.create_random_combinatorial_kernel(n_qubits, n_layers, n_operations)[source]

Create a matrix representation for a randomly generated circuit according to the scheme in https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.11144

Parameters:

  • n_qubits – number of qubits of the circuit

  • n_layers – number of layers of the circuit

Returns:

numpy matrix

quask.techniques.combinatorial_kernel_genetic module

Code base for https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.11144. This module optimize a quantum circuit with a genetic optimization algorithm.

class quask.techniques.combinatorial_kernel_genetic.CombinatorialKernelGenetic(X_train, y_train, X_validation, y_validation, ck, n_qubits, n_layers, num_iterations=1000, num_populations=50, num_breeding_parents=10)[source]

Bases: object

Generate a kernel function by perturbing a random circuit according to a genetic optimization algorithm

energy()[source]

Return the energy of the best solution after optimization

Returns:

energy or 100000 if no good solution has been found

estimate_mse(solution=None, X_test=None, y_test=None)[source]

Estimate the MSE of the current solution.

Parameters:

  • solution – matrix representation of the kernel

  • X_test – testing feature data matrix

  • y_test – testing label data array

Returns:

MSE

estimate_variance_of_kernel(n_sample_variance=5)[source]

Estimate the variance of the kernel function

Parameters:

n_sample_variance – number of pairs of value to be selected

Returns:

(v, l); l = list of randomly selected kernel values, v = variance of l

generate_initial_population()[source]

Generate the initial population randomly

Returns:

None

get_kernel_values(X1, X2=None, solution=None, bandwidth=None)[source]

Calculate kernel gram matrix

Parameters:

  • X1 – feature data of the first batch

  • X2 – feature data of the second batch

  • solution – matrix representation of the circuit

  • bandwidth – optional constant limiting the rotational angles of the transformations

Returns:

kernel gram matrix

run_genetic_optimization()[source]

Run the genetic optimization

Returns:

None

quask.techniques.combinatorial_kernel_greedy module

Code base for https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.11144. This module optimize a quantum circuit with a greedy optimization algorithm.

quask.techniques.combinatorial_kernel_simanneal module

Code base for https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.11144. This module optimize a quantum circuit with a simulated annealing optimization algorithm.

quask.techniques.scrambled_kernel module

Code base for https://arxiv.org/abs/2209.11144. This module generate a randomly generated circuit using qml.ArbitraryUnitary function.

Module dedicated to create a gradient-descend trainable kernel technique

Convert the variational form into its function pointer

Parameters:

n_qubits – Number of qubits of the variational form

Returns:

(fn, n) tuple of function and integer, the former representing the ansatz and the latter the number of parameters
